deviations: Focuses on 3D resonance tensor rather than general high-dimensional vector storage
Specialized for oscillatory dynamics rather than general tensor operations
Missing persistence layer for tensor data
a_blueprint_comparison.notes: The ResonanceTensorField implements a complete 3D oscillatory tensor field with amplitude, frequency, and phase parameters. It provides time evolution, coherence metrics, and singularity detection. While not a general-purpose tensor database, it serves its specific purpose of modeling multidimensional resonance dynamics well. Comprehensive test coverage validates all functionality.

tasks.description: Implement persistence layer for tensor snapshots
Add tensor query API for spatial/temporal queries
Implement sparse tensor representation for large fields
Add support for variable-dimensional tensors (generic over N)
Performance benchmarks for large tensor fields
Document tensor field API and physics model

c_implementation_plan.test_strategy: Existing tests provide excellent coverage of core functionality. Add property-based tests for coherence and singularity detection. Performance benchmarks needed for large tensor fields. Integration tests with resonance engine.
ai_co_creation_opportunities: Generate property-based tests for coherence metrics
Create visualization tools for tensor field evolution
Generate documentation and examples for tensor operations

d_execution.validation_notes: All 24 unit tests pass with comprehensive coverage of functionality. Tests verify time evolution, coherence calculation, gradient norms, singularity detection, parameter setting, and edge cases. Module is production-ready for its current scope.

challenges: Tensor field state management requires careful handling of previous state for gradient computation
Coherence calculation across all cell pairs is O(N^2) and can be expensive for large fields
Floating-point precision issues in phase accumulation over long time periods
Memory usage scales cubically with field dimensions
best_practices: ndarray provides efficient multidimensional array operations
Default trait implementation simplifies common use cases
Separate amplitude, frequency, phase arrays enable independent parameter control
Gradient threshold configurable for different singularity detection needs
Reset method allows field reuse without reallocation
reusable_patterns: Oscillatory field pattern with amplitude, frequency, phase
Time evolution with optional modulation input
Previous state tracking for derivative computation
recommendations: Add serialization for tensor field persistence
Consider sparse representation for large or mostly-zero fields
Add boundary conditions for field edges
Implement FFT-based spectral analysis of tensor evolution
Add tensor field coupling for multi-field interactions
Consider GPU acceleration for large tensor operations

innovation_assessment.rationale: Resonance tensor fields represent a novel approach to modeling multidimensional quantum-resonant dynamics. The innovation is in the application domain rather than the tensor mathematics itself. Low risk as the implementation is complete, well-tested, and mathematically sound. High compatibility with clean API and no breaking dependencies. Not experimental - production-ready for resonance modeling use cases.
